example.name: plain old transitive
example.text: The Herald kept its old-time Hearst readership.

example.name: nominal
example.text: The keeping of animals

example.name: subject control
example.text: John kept *trace* annotating.

example.name: object control with sentential attribute
example.text: Ringers keep the bells sounding in the many belfries of East Anglia.
example.arg: sounding in the many belfries of East Anglia

example.name: object control with Adj attribute
example.text: The captain kept the crew loyal.

example.name: nominal use may be rare or ackward
example.text: The maintenance, the keeping going of the body

example.name: subject control
example.text: John kept *trace* annotating.

example.name: object control with sentential attribute
example.text: Ringers keep the bells sounding in the many belfries of East Anglia.
example.arg: the bells sounding in the many belfries of East Anglia

example.name: object control with Adj attribute
example.text: The captain kept the crew loyal.

example.name: nominal use may be rare or ackward
example.text: The maintenance, the keeping going of the body

roleset.name: light verb (eventually to become replaced by real semantic frames - AMR)
roleset.note: KEEP-V NOTES: For use by AMR for light verbs. PropBank should use the existing .LV roleset instead.

example.name: keep_pace
example.text: Newsweek keeps pace with its rival Time.

example.name: keep_track
example.text: The state keeps track of the achievement-test preparation booklets.

roleset.name: maintain some prepositional relationship
roleset.note: KEEP-V NOTES: This roleset shows some relationship between nouns or gerundsdescribed by the preposition introducing the second noun, and the'keep' is causing or maintaining that relationship. (from keep.04-v)

example.name: be careful with 'from'!
example.text: Growers can't always keep the worm from the apple.

example.name: keep from: quasi-aspectual
example.text: Japanese demand has kept the U.S. currency from *trace* plunging.

example.name: keep out
example.text: Britain kept light tanks out of the talks.

example.name: keep off
example.text: Keep your Foster Savings Institution off the federal budget deficit.

example.name: with attributive
example.text: The Fed kept inflation-fighting as its top priority.

roleset.name: prepositional, comforming (only annotated by amr), prepositional (keeping with)
roleset.note: KEEP-V NOTES: PropBankers: DO NOT ANNOTATE THIS SENSE, AMR: ANNOTATE THIS SENSE! (from keep.06-v)

roles.note: This should ONLY be annotated for AMR!!! not PropBank. (from keep.06-v) This is a complex preposition and takes NO ARGUMENT STRUCTURE! (from keeping.06-n)

example.name: keep with
example.text: ... in *trace=nothing* keeping with the reputation of the company.
example.arg: with the reputation of the company.

example.name: Both args
example.text: There will be no flowers at the funeral, in keeping with the family's wishes.
example.arg: There will be no flowers at the funeral

roleset.name: light verb
roleset.note: KEEP-LV NOTES: This used to be keep.03 (from keep.LV-v)

roleset.name: keep up: maintain one's position, maintaining one's position (relatively)
roleset.note: KEEP_UP-V NOTES: There is a VN class for this VPC, but it's not relevant. (from keep.05-v)

example.name: keeping up with the Joneses
example.text: John can't keep up with Mary's rapid mood swings.

roleset.name: sustain
roleset.note: KEEP_UP-V NOTES: Member of Vncls 55.6. Comparison to keep.01. Added by Julia based on examples in Brown. (from keep.10-v)

roles.note: this sense is transitive, vs. the other 'keep_up', which is intransitive. In this sense, the state of arg1 is what is being maintained, and in the other sense, arg0's state is being maintained. (from keep.10-v)

example.name: maintaining physical entity's good condition
example.text: He did not like to think of all the time and rags and polishes he-1 had spent on *-1 keeping the house up .

example.name: aspectual
example.text: State monopolies will keep on [*-1] stifling trade, ``free'' prices or not, until something else replaces them.

example.name: aspectual
example.text: State monopolies will keep on [*-1] stifling trade, ``free'' prices or not, until something else replaces them.
